Issues.Title: Refactor `ToolStripControlHost.Control` property to throw `ObjectDisposedException` if null
Issues.Body:
Refactored `ToolStripControlHost.Control` property to throw `ObjectDisposedException` if null.
Also some minor refactoring using expression bodies

Fixes #2466

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/8509)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Refactor `ToolStripControlHost.Control` property to throw `ObjectDisposedException` if null" (#8509)

Issues.Title: Winforms Customer Designer
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Winforms Customer Designer" (#8508)

Issues.Title: Making `DataGridView` icons more clear
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #7722


## Proposed changes

- Added a `ControlPaint.CreateBitmapWithInvertedForeColor` method for inverting colors of the bitmap if the image's primary color has low contrast with a background.
- Used the `ControlPaint.CreateBitmapWithInvertedForeColor` method for `DataGridViewRowHeaderCell` images if HC mode is on.
- Covered the `ControlPaint.CreateBitmapWithInvertedForeColor` method with unit tests.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Images in `DataGridViewRowHeaderCell` become more clear.

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->

### After

Issues.Title: Setting GenerateMember to false is not removing class member
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2022
Version 17.4.4
VisualStudio.17.Release/17.4.4+33213.308
Microsoft .NET Framework
Version 4.8.09032

### .NET version

.Net7, .Net6. Others not tested.

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

Yes in old .NET framework designer.

### Issue description

`GenerateMember = false` must remove corresponding class member from `*.Designer.cs`. Actual behavior:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17767561/212486575-cff39aa2-d3e7-4726-a71d-5f24000f856e.png)


### Steps to reproduce

Any winforms project. Open designer, select any existing control on the form, set `GenerateMember` to `false`.
Project to quick test:
[GenerateMemberTest.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/10418373/GenerateMemberTest.zip)

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Setting GenerateMember to false is not removing class member" (#8505)

Issues.Title: Scaling ErrorProvider for high dpi
Issues.Body:
This change involves adding high DPI message handling to the `NativeWindow `class in order to support high DPI for components that are not derived from `Control`. As a result, the `ErrorProvider`, `Timer`, `NotifyIcon`, and `ToolTip `components will benefit from this change.
Changes: 

-  Handling `WM.DPICHANGED_BEFOREPARENT` and `WM.DPICHANGED_AFTERPARENT` messages in `NativeWindow`
-  Replacing Windows Error Icon with WinForms specific Error Icon to remove dependency on Windows in `ErrorProvider`.
- Scaling Error icon according to the Dpi of the monitor in PermonV2mode applications.

Fixes #8264 

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/8486)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Scaling ErrorProvider for high dpi" (#8486)

Issues.Title: Fix multiselect in OpenFileDialog
Issues.Body:
Query for the right interface before getting results and guard correctly.

Adds regression test and fixes a mistake in ComScope.

Adds a little cleanup for easier debugging and I left in a few defines that are difficult to find and we'll want to use soon. (I tried a variety of approaches to automating, including sending key messages and using accessibility. Sending WM_COMMAND is far simpler.)

fixes: #8414


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/8500)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix multiselect in OpenFileDialog" (#8500)

Issues.Title: Move GetIUnknownForObject calls to ComHelpers
Issues.Body:
We want to keep our Marshal calls in ComHelpers so we can do the right logic regarding ComWrappers vs. Marshal.

Remove AdviseHelper and use the new functionality to set up the notifications (much simpler).

Move IRichEditOleCallback to CsWin32. Add new static helper to DataObject to create from a native IDataObject.


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/8498)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Move GetIUnknownForObject calls to ComHelpers" (#8498)

Issues.Body:
Also added some tests to better cover the KeysConverter.

Fixes #8456

Issues.Title: System.Windows.Forms.Design.DateTimePickerDesigner is missing
Issues.Body:
### Environment

N/A

### .NET version

.NET 6

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

Worked in .NET Framework.

### Issue description

We need to have DateTimePicker controls available in a WF designer that we host in our app, which is being ported from .NET Framework to .NET 6. As per https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/4908, DateTimePickerDesigner hasn't been ported from .NET Framework.

Looking at the decompiled sources of `DateTimePickerDesigner`, it's not much code and the reason it wasn't ported is unclear. In fact, if we add a DateTimePicker to the designer programmatically, it appears there but is not clickable, and a clickable component is added to the component tray.

We'd really appreciate any suggestions on solving this.

### Steps to reproduce

N/A

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "System.Windows.Forms.Design.DateTimePickerDesigner is missing" (#8501)

Issues.Title: Wrong display of selected folder in FolderBrowserDialog with WPF in vb.
Issues.Body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/Wrong-display-of-selected-folder-in-Fold/10176303)._

---
Hello,

With version 17.6.3 of visual studio with .Net 6 in WPF in VB language, I use the FolderBrowserDialog dialog box.  
I initialize the SelectedPath property with the value: “P:\\Gestion\_REDWOOD”.  
When displaying the dialog box, I notice that the name of the folder displayed in the textbox is truncated.  
The displayed and selected text is “estion\_REDWOOD”.  
If I move the cursor to the beginning of the text or if I press the “Home” key, I can see all the text

Here is my code :

```  
Private Sub btnDialogueDestination_Click(sender As Object, e As RoutedEventArgs) Handles btnDialogueDestination.Click

	'Sélection du dossier de destination

	Dim openFolderDialog As New Forms.FolderBrowserDialog()
	openFolderDialog.SelectedPath = txtDestination.Text
	openFolderDialog.Description = "Dossier de destination sur le cloud"
	If openFolderDialog.ShowDialog = Forms.DialogResult.OK Then
		txtDestination.Text = openFolderDialog.SelectedPath
	End If

End Sub
  
```

Here is a screenshot :

![FolderBrowserDialog.gif](https://aka.ms/dc/image?name=B9f6c3798e8774842a4354c18d2d7e0e4638017578647322735_FolderBrowserDialog.gif&tid=9f6c3798e8774842a4354c18d2d7e0e4638017578647322735)

The problem is also present with the “OpenFileDialog” dialog box.  
The file name is also truncated.

If the number of characters in the file name is less than the code example above, the file name display is correct. From a certain length of text, the text shifts to the left to be displayed. It is then truncated.

Correct display, smaller text.  
![openFileDialog1.png](https://aka.ms/dc/image?name=B040d3dd7a065447d9794f8a84322d2ea638017741879118098_openFileDialog1.png&tid=040d3dd7a065447d9794f8a84322d2ea638017741879118098)

---

#### Feedback Bot on 10/19/2022, 01:24 PM: 

(private comment, text removed)

Issues.Title: [ 8.0.100-alpha.1.23060.3] mRemoteNg app Error creating window handle error while creating Combobox
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

```
.NET SDK:
 Version:   8.0.100-alpha.1.23060.3
 Commit:    c5ebd18478

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.19045
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\8.0.100-alpha.1.23060.3\

Host:
  Version:      8.0.0-alpha.1.23058.2
  Architecture: x64
  Commit:       5da4a9e919

.NET SDKs installed:
  8.0.100-alpha.1.23060.3 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

.NET runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 8.0.0-alpha.1.23058.7 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 8.0.0-alpha.1.23058.2 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 8.0.0-alpha.1.23057.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]
```

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

N/A

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

**Verify Scenarios:**

1) Windows 10 21H2 AMD64 + 8.0.100-alpha.1.23061.8: Fail
2). Windows 10 21H2 AMD64 + dotnet-sdk-8.0.100-alpha.1.23060.31: Fail
3) Windows 10 21H2 AMD64 + dotnet-sdk-7.0.102-win-x64: Pass
4). Windows 10 21H2 AMD64 + dotnet-sdk-6.0.405-win-x64: Pass

### Issue description

When test 3rd party mRemoteNg app with .NET 8 runtime, exception "error creating window handle error" shows while creating Combobox.

**Application Name**:  mRemoteNg(1.77.3)
**OS**: Windows 10 21H2
**CPU**: X64
**.NET Build Number:** dotnet-sdk-8.0.100-alpha.1.23060.3
App or App Source checking at: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1717274
**Github Link**: https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG

### Steps to reproduce

**The machine only has 8.0 installed. And DOTNET_ROLL_FORWARD_ON_NO_CANDIDATE_FX=2 is set.**

1.Copy app from AppSource\SourceShare\mRemoteNG  to machine
2.Launch the app from mRemoteNG.exe
3.If you see update window, click ask me later
4.Click Tools=>Port Scan

**Expected Result:** 
Port Scan Tab should open without error

**Actual Result:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/83067197/212040757-a0389789-ff38-4cbb-8aeb-868cb001bb3d.png)


**Exception:**
Exception Message
"Error creating window handle."
```
Stack trace
   at System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.CreateHandle(CreateParams cp)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateHandle()
   at System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.CreateHandle()
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateControl(Boolean ignoreVisible)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateControl(Boolean ignoreVisible)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateControl()
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WmShowWindow(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.Callback(HWND hWnd, WM msg, WPARAM wparam, LPARAM lparam)

Environment
OS: Microsoft Windows NT 10.0.19045.0
mRemoteNG Version: 1.77.3
Edition: MSI
Cmd line args:

```
**Findings:**
We think this error happens when creating combobox control, app is overriding OnCreateControl, when we remove DrawMode = DrawMode.OwnerDrawFixed, issue does not repro.
In this file: mRemoteNG-1.77.3-dev\mRemoteNG\UI\Controls\mrngComboBox.cs
```
 protected override void OnCreateControl()
  {
            base.OnCreateControl();
            _themeManager = ThemeManager.getInstance();
            if (!_themeManager.ActiveAndExtended) return;
            BackColor = _themeManager.ActiveTheme.ExtendedPalette.getColor("ComboBox_Background");
            ForeColor = _themeManager.ActiveTheme.ExtendedPalette.getColor("ComboBox_Foreground");
             DrawMode = DrawMode.OwnerDrawFixed;  //if we remove, issue does not repro
            SetStyle(ControlStyles.OptimizedDoubleBuffer |
                     ControlStyles.UserPaint, true);
}
```
@dotnet-actwx-bot @dotnet/compat
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[ 8.0.100-alpha.1.23060.3] mRemoteNg app Error creating window handle error while creating Combobox" (#8495)

Issues.Title: [Test case] X and Y for some controls' Bounds are not correct after set_Bounds method
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-alpha.1.23061.8 + latest winforms dlls

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it works in .NET Core 3.1 and .NET 5.0/6.0/7.0/8.0(without latest winforms dlls)

### Issue description

The X and Y values in **newRect** should be the same as values in **c.Bounds**.
![GetImage](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864985/212028009-b281fc59-46a7-47f5-bbb9-68dae6ee278e.png)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Download the test case project from here: https://microsoft-my.sharepoint.com/:u:/g/personal/v-peqiao_microsoft_com1/ERuveT35qepKkfb15DOVQl0BoIsTvsTQfUc1XyNSeqyYyg?e=FUvmnA
2. Open the **XPropertyGrid** project in VS.
3. Open the **XControl.cs** in **WFCTestLib** project>>**ReflectTools**>>**AutoPME** node.
4. Set the debug point at 3791 line.
5. Star to debug the **XPropertyGrid** project.
6. Check the X and Y values in **newRect** and **c.Bounds** when debug stopped at 3791 line in XControl.cs file.

![Setbounds](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864985/212031866-a1b03e66-646f-420e-9e7f-9f858a0eed36.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue " [Test case] X and Y for some controls' Bounds are not correct after set_Bounds method" (#8494)

Issues.Title: Fix JAWS announcing 'context menu' and not announcing 'leaving menus' when navigating through MenuStrip items
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Partially fixes #7770

The problem:
- JAWS announces 'context menu' for top-level menu items
- JAWS does not announce 'leaving menus' when switching focus from MenuStrip back to form


## Proposed changes

- Publish AutomationPropertyChangedEvent for property ExpandCollapseExpandCollapseStatePropertyId when ToolStripDropDownItem opens or closes its dropdown
- Replace SystemMenuStart/SystemMenuEnd events with MenuOpenedEvent/MenuClosedEvent in MenuStrip class
- Remove SystemMenuPopupStart/SystemMenuPopupEnd event publication from ToolStripDropDown class
 

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- JAWS correctly announces MenuStrip items as menus, not context menus
- JAWS announce exiting menu mode
- Narrator announces menu expanding
- NVDA menu announcements do not change 

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/113603457/211622788-89696e8b-7d2e-44ce-b91e-4e9c147fc56f.mp4

Narrator speech:

> menuStrip1 menu bar, File, menu item, collapsed, menu key Alt+ f, 
> File, menu, 
> New, menu item, menu key n, Ctrl+ N, 
> File, menu, 
> Exit menuStrip1 menu bar, Enter Click to open ContextMenuStrip, button, 
> Click to open ContextMenuStrip, button, 
> menu, 
> menu, 
> toolStripMenuItem1, menu item, 
> toolStripMenuItem2, menu item, 

JAWS speech:

> Menu bar
> File 
> To navigate press Left or Right Arrow.
> f
> menu
> New Ctrl+N 
> To move through items press up or down arrow.
> n
> Context Menu 
> File 
> To navigate press Left or Right Arrow.
> s
> menu
> New Ctrl+N 
> To move through items press up or down arrow.
> n
> Context Menu
> File 
> To navigate press Left or Right Arrow.
